pullRequest.title: Support feel expressions for multi instance activities
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Specifically, this PR provides support for feel expressions for the
inputCollection and outputElement variables for multi instance
activities.
Related issues
closes #3804
closes #4101

nodes.bodyText: The method is only used in MultiInstanceBodyCompletedHandler. Moving it to the caller gives us more context of how it is used.
Instead of returning null, I think it is better to deal with an optional.

Throwing an exception here is dangerous 💥 It is very unlikely but the input collection variable might change. If it is not an array anymore then an exception is thrown and the workflow instance stops processing at all (i.e. added to the "blacklist").
It would be better to handle the case and create an incident instead. So, the workflow instance can be repaired and continue processing (which is not the case if it is added to the "blacklist").

Why did you change the method visibility?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              protected void updateOutputCollection(
          
          
            
              private void updateOutputCollection(

We can be tricky and avoid cloning the buffer by moving readOutputElementVariable(context); on top 😈
The output element result is resolved by the expression language which uses its own buffers.
I think we can keep this check now after dealing with the outputElement variable name.

nodes.bodyText: You can use BrokerClassRuleHelper.getJobType() (a JUnit test watcher rule) to get unique job types for each test case.
This stream of jobs is not limited, for example, by calling .limit(3). So, it waits until the timeout.

-            "Expected multi-instance input collection variable '"

                 + INPUT_COLLECTION
-                + "' to be an ARRAY, but found 'STRING'.");
+                + "' to be 'ARRAY', but was 'STRING'.");

nodes.bodyText:
This is not the failure you're looking for 🤖
It seems that the FEEL engine doesn't like variable names starting with some (which is a reserved word in FEEL).
Since the output element variable would be created when the multi-instance element is activated, we need to use some kind of expression (e.g. sum(r)).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -115,9 +128,61 @@ public void shouldCreateIncidentIfInputVariableIsNotAnArray() {
         .hasElementId(elementInstance.getValue().getElementId())
         .hasErrorType(ErrorType.EXTRACT_VALUE_ERROR)
         .hasErrorMessage(
-            "Expected multi-instance input collection variable '"
+            "Expected result of the expression '"
                 + INPUT_COLLECTION
-                + "' to be an ARRAY, but found 'STRING'.");
+                + "' to be 'ARRAY', but was 'STRING'.");
+  }
+
+  @Test
+  public void shouldCreateIncidentIfOutputElementExpressionEvaluationFailed() {
+    // given
+    final long workflowInstanceKey =
+        ENGINE
+            .workflowInstance()
+            .ofBpmnProcessId(PROCESS_ID)
+            .withVariable(INPUT_COLLECTION, List.of(1, 2, 3))
+            .create();
+
+    // when
+    final List<Record<JobRecordValue>> created =
+        RecordingExporter.jobRecords(JobIntent.CREATED)
+            .withType(jobType)
+            .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+            .asList();
+    assertThat(created).hasSize(3);
+
+    final Record<JobBatchRecordValue> jobs = ENGINE.jobs().withType(jobType).activate();
+    assertThat(jobs.getValue().getJobs()).hasSize(3);
+
+    for (final long key : jobs.getValue().getJobKeys()) {
+      ENGINE.job().withKey(key).complete();
+    }
+    final List<Record<JobRecordValue>> completed =
+        RecordingExporter.jobRecords(JobIntent.COMPLETED)
+            .withType(jobType)
+            .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+            .asList();
+    assertThat(completed).hasSize(3);
+
+    // then
+    final Record<IncidentRecordValue> incident =
+        RecordingExporter.incidentRecords(IncidentIntent.CREATED)
+            .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+            .getFirst();
+
+    final Record<WorkflowInstanceRecordValue> elementInstance =
+        RecordingExporter.workflowInstanceRecords(WorkflowInstanceIntent.ELEMENT_COMPLETING)
+            .withWorkflowInstanceKey(workflowInstanceKey)
+            .withElementId(ELEMENT_ID)
+            .getFirst();
+
+    Assertions.assertThat(incident.getValue())
+        .hasElementInstanceKey(elementInstance.getKey())
+        .hasElementId(elementInstance.getValue().getElementId())
+        .hasErrorType(ErrorType.EXTRACT_VALUE_ERROR)
+        .hasErrorMessage(
+            "failed to parse expression 'some_result': [1.12] error: "
+                + "'in' expected but end of source found\n\nsome_result\n           ^");

afterCommit.message: chore(engine): only validate outputElement expression if present

commit.message:
feat(engine): support feel expressions for multi instance activities

Specifically, this commit provides support for feel expressions for the
inputCollection and outputElement variables for multi instance
activities.

beforeCommit.message: chore(engine): only validate outputElement expression if present
